meanings.definition: Prepare (a building) for a specific climate or weather conditions.
meanings.sent1: We are weatherizing our house for the cold winter ahead.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers are weatherizing the new office building to withstand heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: I tried weatherizing my car with an umbrella, but it didn't work!
meanings.sent4: She weatherized her garden against the scorching sun by planting shade-providing trees.
meanings.sent5: The sailors weatherized the ship before the storm, ensuring its safety.

meanings.definition: Make (something) resistant to the effects of weather.
meanings.sent1: The special paint is weatherizing the metal gate against rust.
meanings.sent2: The waterproof sealant is weatherizing the wooden deck to prevent water damage.
meanings.sent3: He thought weatherizing his phone with a raincoat would protect it from the rain.
meanings.sent4: The thick coat of paint weatherized the fence, making it durable against the elements.
meanings.sent5: The weatherizing spray shielded the outdoor furniture from the harsh sunlight.
